definition: to hold on to/to defend/to keep/to guard
to guard/to defend/to keep watch/to abide by the law/to observe (rules or ritual)/nearby/adjoining
to live/to dwell/to stay/to reside/to stop/(suffix indicating firmness, steadiness, or coming to a halt)

sentences.english: But can convey with the character only, we should defend that adorably .
sentences.chinese: 但只能用文字表達的，我們要把那塊美妙守住。

sentences.english: He can withhold the China nationalism and in the same time to blow his horn of democracy loudly.
sentences.chinese: 他一邊能守住民族大義，也能高吹民主的號角。

sentences.english: Keep the mind pure and undefiled. Remain calm and serene always.
sentences.chinese: 守住清淨無爲的心，讓心時時寂靜。

sentences.english: Whether can hold you give me beauty?
sentences.chinese: 是否就能守住你給我的美？

sentences.english: The most our one battalion can manage is to keep the road to the county town open.
sentences.chinese: 鎮裏的一營兵只夠守住那條到縣裏去的要路。

sentences.english: The Japanese aggressors in order to hold their positions, you must ensure WanDing bridge is not an accident.
sentences.chinese: 日寇爲了守住陣地，必須要保證畹町橋不出事。

sentences.english: Can we still keep that pure emotion?
sentences.chinese: 我們是否還能守住那份單純的感情？

sentences.english: But as difficult as the testing may be, we can keep our faith in God.
sentences.chinese: 不過，熬煉縱然難受，我們仍然能守住對神的信心。

sentences.english: Dr Livesey take the north side, if you please;
sentences.chinese: 利弗西醫生，煩勞你守住北面。

sentences.english: To keep the fruit of "shaking" it is necessary to have the support of blazing fire.
sentences.chinese: 爲了守住“搖”來地成果，必須藉以烈火。

sentences.english: Ripple but have no language, guarded happiness of this pond. This is from cradle to the grave one a life time
sentences.chinese: 盪漾而無語，守住了這一池的幸福。

sentences.english: In front of her, hold the moral bottom line, is the minimum life part.
sentences.chinese: 在美色面前，守住道德底線，是做人的起碼本分。

sentences.english: The goal now is to hold Buner.
sentences.chinese: 現在的目標是守住布納。

sentences.english: This time, the Spurs made it hold up.
sentences.chinese: 而這一次，馬刺守住了自己。

sentences.english: Holding this hill-top for twenty-four hours will ensure our victory over the enemy.
sentences.chinese: 能守住這個山頂24小時就可以保證我們戰勝敵人。

definition: to defend one's property to the death/to cling obstinately to old habits/die-hard
to guard/to defend/to keep watch/to abide by the law/to observe (rules or ritual)/nearby/adjoining
(military) (of a city etc) to fall into enemy hands/(fig.) to take a turn for the worse
to strongly defend one's position/to be entrenched/to cling to
to retreat and defend/to withdraw and maintain one's guard
to control/to curb/to restrict/to impede/to pin down (enemy troops)
to take back (forcibly)/to recapture/to win back
to escape unscathed/to get through in one piece
to make a breakthrough/to break through/to breach (military)
to seek to protect/to ensure/to maintain/to guard
to seize/to capture/to wrest control of
